title: Immunizations
cleaned_text: date? Are yours? Looking out for your child's total health and wellness includes keeping them up to date on preventative immunizations, allowing them to be their best self every day. It's also important to stay up-to-date with your own immunizations because immunity from childhood vaccines can wear off over time. What vaccines does your CHILD need? Take the [childhood vaccine quiz](https://www2a.cdc.gov/vaccines/childquiz/) to see recommended vaccines and when they should receive them. No insurance? The [Vaccines for Children (VFC) Program](/topics/programs/immunizations/Pages/VFC.aspx) provides vaccines to children who do not have health insurance. What vaccines do ADULTS need? Use the [adult vaccine assessment tool](https://www2.cdc.gov/nip/adultimmsched/) to find out which vaccines are recommended for adults based on age, health conditions, job, and other factors. - Learn more about vaccines for [adults](/topics/programs/immunizations/Pages/Adult.aspx). Looking for a replacement COVID-19 vaccine card? We can help by sending you a record of your immunizations! Please visit the [PA-SIIS page](/topics/Reporting-Registries/PA-SIIS/Pages/PA-SIIS.aspx) and complete the Authorization for Release of Immunizations Records Form.
